reviews.text:
If I could give a half star rating I would, so count this as a 4.5 out of 5 star review. The target star of the show at Heirloom pizza is their pizza sauce. It complements the cheesy garlic bread well and really brings together the deep dish pizza. The thin crust is good too!

Now in terms of the deep dish pizza. Im from the Midwest, just north of Chicago. This isnt deep dish, but its not bad. It is actually the best deep dish we've had in California. If youre looking for a classic Chicago style pie, youll be disappointed. But if youre looking for a play on Chicago style, its worth a try!

In terms of service, we've had two servers. One was fairly unnatenntive but overall they weren't rude or standoff ish. The other person we had was phenomenal. Brought refills, gave us updates, and packed our left overs nicely.

If youre looking for take out, we've done that with the thin crust and cheesy bread. I wouldnt do the cheesy bread again. If youre within 5-10 minutes youd probably have better luck with that. The pizza was fine and it reheated well enough.

We will be back as its our #2 pizza place in Monterey.

It‚Äôs just a short walk from Del Monte Ave., in a quieter part of town. We loved the light Shimmer Pilsner, which comes in a pretty can too. The cheesy garlic bread was a good appetizer, and that kept our hunger at bay while we waited for our deep dish pizza! It took about 20 minutes. The pizza may look messy, but is oh so good!! A small can easily be shared by three people.

Love this place. I get big pies or I stop in for a cheesy garlic bread to go. I ate the edges before I took a pic but this stuff is EXCELLENT. My favorite cheese garlic bread and deep dish pies. The appetizers are fire too

Luckily we got there early enough to beat the rush. I‚Äôve had pizza‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve had lots of pizza‚Ä¶ this was by far the best pizza I‚Äôve ever had. Staff was phenomenal, food came quick. Salads were fantastic, chicken wings were solid. Would definitely come back if I‚Äôm ever in the area again.

This place was pretty good! The server was very nice and attentive and even proactively addressed the issue when they delivered me the wrong pizza (I hadn't even noticed). The pizza itself was quite flavorful, not bland like other deep dish pizzas I've had before. The sauce was tangy and there was a good amount of cheese. My only criticism was the crust was lacking in flavor. It was crispy and blended well with the topping but wasn't very compelling on its own. Overall I'd recommend though. Great experience.

editorial_summary.overview: Deep-dish, thin-crust & build-your-own pizzas & salads in a welcoming neighborhood setting.

recentReviews.text: Always a staple when coming here. Try the Bixby!

Great food, awesome ambiance.
Great lady at the front.

We had a great time eating here! We got a salad and a deep dish pizza and it was plenty for three adults. Our server was very nice and introduce us to (iirc) the Pomegranate beer which was very tasty. The pizza was delicious and the ingredients tasteed very fresh. if they were selling it, I would totally have bought their salad dressing. I would highly recommend this place after a day of hiking in the area.
This is a great place the service is awesome and the pizzas is by far the best I've ever tasted. I recommend this place you won't be disappointed.
Love the deep dish pizza. We went twice in a week!
Pizza was great, but compared to European standards the pizza is quite pricy.

The food itself is really second to none. Make sure you order the deep dish pizza though. The deep dish separates itself from all other pizzas. The sauce has the right amount of zest and the crust is flaky & delicious. Ingredients always taste fresh. Get the bomb beets and broccoli to make it healthy. Usually great service go there often, but today they forgot my broccoli. That was a first, so I will still come here for the best deep dish pizza!

If I could give a half star rating I would, so count this as a 4.5 out of 5 star review. The target star of the show at Heirloom pizza is their pizza sauce. It complements the cheesy garlic bread well and really brings together the deep dish pizza. The thin crust is good too!

Now in terms of the deep dish pizza. Im from the Midwest, just north of Chicago. This isnt deep dish, but its not bad. It is actually the best deep dish we've had in California. If youre looking for a classic Chicago style pie, youll be disappointed. But if youre looking for a play on Chicago style, its worth a try!

In terms of service, we've had two servers. One was fairly unnatenntive but overall they weren't rude or standoff ish. The other person we had was phenomenal. Brought refills, gave us updates, and packed our left overs nicely.

If youre looking for take out, we've done that with the thin crust and cheesy bread. I wouldnt do the cheesy bread again. If youre within 5-10 minutes youd probably have better luck with that. The pizza was fine and it reheated well enough.

We will be back as its our #2 pizza place in Monterey.
The best pizza in town hands down ‚ù§Ô∏èüòãü§§

detailedReviews.text: Hard to find a good gluten free pizza these days, Heirloom makes makes a good one and keeps it consistsnt. Nice to have in Salinas now too!

detailedReviews.author: Michael Bond
detailedReviews.text: The best pizza on the peninsula and beyond. Great ingredients make for delicious flavor and the corn meal crust is perfect! A don‚Äôt miss restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Big Jake
detailedReviews.text: Love this place. I get big pies or I stop in for a cheesy garlic bread to go. I ate the edges before I took a pic but this stuff is EXCELLENT. My favorite cheese garlic bread and deep dish pies. The appetizers are fire too

detailedReviews.text: The pizza is pretty good, but, a for a deep dish pizza, the crust is pretty sub standard. I think they're premade. Ours was a bit stale tasting.

The cheesy garlic bread was a good appetizer, and that kept our hunger at bay while we waited for our deep dish pizza! It took about 20 minutes. The pizza may look messy, but is oh so good!! detailedReviews.text: Love this spot!!!! Ultimate fave!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Borkin
detailedReviews.text: Visiting town for the week and our friends recommended this place.  The pineapple pepperoni was incredibly good.  Has a bit of spice to it.

detailedReviews.author: Grant Hirahara
detailedReviews.text: As always, fresh salad ingredents for Cesar salad.  Have been getting the thick crust pizzas but wanted to try thin crust and was pleasantly surprised at the no sag slice and ingredients on the Napoli were flavorful.  We went at opening and seated right away and received attentive service.

detailedReviews.author: colton waite
detailedReviews.text: Very good and the staff was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: U_ly81
detailedReviews.text: I love this pizza. It's great. All the food is good but this is the 4th or 5th time they mess up the order. Even when they repeat back the order to you over the phone, they even write it correctly on the box but the pizza itself, comes out incorrectly. Kind of frustrating. Pull it together..

detailedReviews.author: Mark Chin
detailedReviews.text: Best pIzza ever

detailedReviews.author: Gary Brown
detailedReviews.text:
Give the person whom is paying for your success a right of passage!

You can‚Äôt order a small pizza at 8:04?!!!!

Rules are rules and ordering after 8:00 is forbidden!

A patron should never be cast aside. Explain your failure when you give control for this decision from a front counter employee?

8:04 pm really!

Good day and never again!

detailedReviews.author: Romina Sparano
detailedReviews.text: Awesome spot and yummy pizzas!!!

detailedReviews.author: Ron Baxter
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in town. Always awesome. E always get extra so we have left overs for lunch the next day, it‚Äôs that good! Recommend deep dish arugulalala, delicious!

detailedReviews.author: Tara C
detailedReviews.text: We always get take out and it‚Äôs the best deep dish pizza around!

detailedReviews.author: Trevor Sanders
detailedReviews.text: Wow

detailedReviews.author: Joey Silva
detailedReviews.text: Heirloom is our favorite place for date night! We treat ourselves every Friday night. Yes, Heirloom is our favorite pizza place, but that isn‚Äôt really accurate to say. There is pizza and then there is Heirloom. It is simply on a different level. Their deep dish pizza is out of this world. We have not tried a pie we have not liked, but our favorites are the Heirloom and the Pesto Potato. An Heirloom Pizza to go and a show at the Forest Theatre is pretty much right out of a magazine. Almost unfair how spoiled we are. If you haven‚Äôt had Heirloom you are missing out. If you choose not to give it a try, I am sorry for you.

detailedReviews.author: Charles Beren
detailedReviews.text:
There is no atmosphere to really talk about.  It's primarily a good place to pick up a pizza to go.
Pizzas are among the best on the Monterey peninsula

detailedReviews.author: A. D.
detailedReviews.text: Sehr gute Pizza... Guter Service!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Doan
detailedReviews.text: One of my favorite pizza places in the Bay Area. The potato pizza and PB and G are amazing combinations of flavor! The crusts are super flavorful and crispy and delicious way! I‚Äôm always so excited to come back.

detailedReviews.author: Jos√© Edmilson santos
detailedReviews.text: Comida com pre√ßo justo e gostosa.

detailedReviews.author: Julia R
detailedReviews.text:
An ok/good experience. We tried Bixby deep dish, it was a bit underwhelming. The beet appetizer was delicious.
Patio + inside tables.

detailedReviews.author: Denisse Rodriguez
detailedReviews.text: always great service and great food, best drinks.

detailedReviews.author: Tom Warner
detailedReviews.text: Great deep dish pizza üëå

detailedReviews.author: Sam Wong
detailedReviews.text: Staff was helpful.   My pizza was a Lil salty.   Good salad

detailedReviews.author: A.H. Plotts
detailedReviews.text: We love Heirloom Pizza! The best pizza on the Peninsula!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Gallegos
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Bobbi Kamil
detailedReviews.text: We did takeout and had a wonderful deep dish pizza, a ceasar salad and terrific broccoli. The food is  always ready when they say it will be.

detailedReviews.author: Jillian Peterson
detailedReviews.text: As a Chicago native, I feel at home at heirloom Pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Paul Tibbs
detailedReviews.text: Elizabeth was very pleasant and provided great service.  Great pizza, salad, and beer/wine selection.

detailedReviews.author: David Wick
detailedReviews.text: We love Heirloom‚Äôs deep dish pizza. Their salads make the perfect starter.

detailedReviews.author: mike bailey
detailedReviews.text: Consistently good pizza - deep dish or thin crust   Always ready when promised

detailedReviews.author: T Renee
detailedReviews.text: Moving to Monterey from Chicago, I was so happy to find Heirloom Pizza. It brings such nostalgia. The customer service is great and the deep dish pizza is also great! I will have to try the regular thin pizza next. The cheesy garlic bread was also good.

detailedReviews.author: Nicholas Thomas
detailedReviews.text: First off, this isn't Chicago deep-dish, it's California Central Coast deep-dish and that's alright.  The flavor profile isn't as ostentatious and in your face in the way Gino's East or Lou Malnati's are, but the ingredients taste fresher and are probably better for you.  The flavor and texture of the crust makes me think that it's possibly made with whole grain flour.  The sauce is chunky, as a good deep dish pizza should have, and the cheese has the proper pull.  We ordered a 9 inch pie and weren't able to to finish it in one sitting, but it was cravable enough to heat up for lunch the next day.  It passed the microwave test with flying colors and I enjoyed it, perhaps even more the second time around.  Definitely a unique take on deep dish and quite unlike anything I've had before.  Price point was very reasonable and the service was super friendly and prompt.  Totally worth the visit if you are in Monterey.  Beware of very limited seating and long wait times, however!

detailedReviews.author: Elizabeth Amirkhan
detailedReviews.text: Elizabeth was awesome - thank you!

detailedReviews.author: Caterina Meyers
detailedReviews.text: Delicious pizza and appetizers with excellent service.

detailedReviews.author: John Walsh
detailedReviews.text: Customer service as good as the pies.

detailedReviews.author: Rahma Javed
detailedReviews.text: I quite liked the place and the pizza and the service was very nice but I was very dissapointed because they put meat in my vegetarian pizza. üòûüòûüòû

detailedReviews.author: Agustin Jr. Navarro
detailedReviews.text: This is not pizza it's flat bread with poor tasting sauce. The customer service was terrible. Deep dish was just a bunch of tomato cans dumped into an over cooked dry crust. To expensive for the low quality food.

detailedReviews.author: maurizio g
detailedReviews.text: Everything is ok good experience.

detailedReviews.author: Nicholas M.
detailedReviews.text: Their deep dish is my fav pizza in the Monterey area.

detailedReviews.author: Lanita Pesh
detailedReviews.text: Really unique deep dish pizza; the veggie one is fantastic, laden w healthy stuff, yet still tastes sinfully delicious. Wings, or " wangs", as they're called here, are meaty.

detailedReviews.author: Darara Borodge
detailedReviews.text:
Got the Bixby slider and extra spicy chicken wings. Felt that wings were good but the deep dish pizza left a lot to be desired. If you are craving deep dish in the area this is probably the only place to get it, but I'll probably get my pizza fix somewhere else in the future.

As a plus, I thought the staff were really friendly so I hate that I didn't like the pizza as much.

detailedReviews.author: June Henry
detailedReviews.text: Food great & staff very welcoming.

detailedReviews.author: Ramon Sanchez
detailedReviews.text: Fantastic  arugula salad, pizza was terrible. I can still taste the frozen crust ü§Æ, service was awful as well. Giving it a one star just because salad was great.

detailedReviews.author: Elena Baruah
detailedReviews.text: Very busy place! Great pizza and chicken wings. It gets really busy and there was a long line outside already at 5.30pm on Saturday evening. Good thing we had a reservation.

detailedReviews.author: Travis Klein
detailedReviews.text:
We waited a very long time for the dry broccoli. I think it was about 1hr 10min(an extra 35minutes after the pizza was ready)...Which is insane!

The staff was constantly apologetic, and was clearly overloaded. We both weren't very impressed with the pizza either.

Maybe this was an off night and worth trying again. But wanted folks to know to bring their patience here as many were frustrated, and waiting very long.

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Camden
detailedReviews.text: The pizza was very good but the dressing for the Ceasar salad was off did not taste good at all but I would definitely go back

detailedReviews.author: Hillary S
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! They have really good deep dish pizzas and thin crust as well. Garlic bread was the best and I even liked the beets appetizer (even though I never have liked beets before). Prices were reasonable

detailedReviews.author: Pat McNeill
detailedReviews.text: We always do takeout here. Orders ready in 30 minutes. Minimum waiting at pick-up.  The deep dish pizza is a pleasant surprise to many we get it for.

detailedReviews.author: Dani M
detailedReviews.text: Una de las mejores Deep pizza que he comido, la especial de la casa est√° espectacular y con una raci√≥n peque√±a (8 pulgadas) es suficiente para dos personas. Y el trato muy bueno.

detailedReviews.author: Bene We
detailedReviews.text: We had the thin crust sweet & spicy. It‚Äôs a huge pizza, I definitely recommend doing by here!

detailedReviews.author: Spotmovement
detailedReviews.text: We searched for a Restaurant near our Hotel and find this piece of heaven! The Wings are spicy and very tasty. The deep-dish-pizza was out of this world! So aromatic and and so tasty ü§§ for a good price. Thank you so much üòã

detailedReviews.author: Chas Kuhn
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in for some wings and a Chicago style deepdish. I must say, the wings were some of the best I've ever had and the pizza was totally authentic. A little cornmeal added into the crust and the crust was very crunchy. Truly a delicious and filling deepdish pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Madrik Basmarjian
detailedReviews.text: Always a great take-out experience.

detailedReviews.author: Marcie Thibeau
detailedReviews.text: Always excellent and a crowd pleaser.

detailedReviews.author: Rebecca Katz
detailedReviews.text:
Tried Heirloom Pizza at the Salinas location. It was a great experience!  The service from the manager to the wait staff was excellent!
Had the wings that had a very tasty dry rub on them. We also were able to make changes to a pizza to accommodate our tastes and it was PERFECT!  We will be back for sure!

detailedReviews.author: Rebecca Haywood
detailedReviews.text: While in the area we decided to try this establishment. The deep-dish pizza was very flavorful and fresh, the service was just ok, could have been better. The wait time for food to. come out is significant, I can't give it too high of a mark because for pizza it was super pricey, we spent almost 40 dollars on 1  deep dish pizza, just too much, and 1 ale cost 11 dollars.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the deep dish pizza, highlighting its unique sauce, flaky crust, and fresh ingredients, making it a standout in California. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
